entry.title: The Hunt for the Argent Codex
entry.summary:
Author: Ticket_to_Insanity

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,400Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 14

Summary: Hunters across the globe are seeking the Argent Codex - a mythical book said to hold spells, maps, and rituals that can tip the supernatural balance. After a mysterious group attacks Scott and steals a page from Deaton's collection, Stiles is forced to team up with Derek, who recently returned to Beacon Hills tracking the same cult.The two set off on a road trip across old supernatural sites to stop the cult from reassembling the Codex. Between magical threats, near-death experiences, and cramped motel rooms, their antagonism starts giving way to something hotter... and far more dangerous.

entry.title: Run
entry.summary:
Author: Ivy Posion (viletty)

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,699Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 23

Summary: She ran.She ran from her past, from her present and hopefully her future. Hoping beyond all hell that the darkness inside her didn't consume her. That the blood at her feet would stop rising.That the beast chasing at her heels would never catch her.So she ran. With no hope of rest.That is until they finally stopped her.I SUCK at summaries. It's interesting I promise. This was originally a one-shot songfic based on Danity Kane - Stay with me.

entry.title: Blood and Ashes
entry.summary:
Author: lavieboheme0919

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,519Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 3

Summary: Several centuries after the Last Battle, the White Tower stands taller than ever—rebuilt, restructured, and reeling from new threats that no one dares name aloud. Saidin has returned, cleansed and chaotic, and the Hall of the Tower seeks control more than balance. When Stiles—a powerful male channeler raised to Aes Sedai—survives a narrow vote in the Hall for flouting Tower law and custom, he’s spared gentling… but not punishment.Bound without consent to Sitters from opposing Ajahs, declared the first Striker since the Age of Legends, Stiles finds himself weaponized by a Tower that fears what it cannot command. But Stiles is not their dog to tame, and the Tower is not as united as it pretends to be. As ancient tensions simmer and forgotten enemies stir, bonds—both sacred and profane—will be tested.This is not the story of the Dragon. This is what comes after.Power without trust. Bonds without love. And one man who will burn down the Pattern before letting them leash him again.

entry.title: Can't help but wonder where I'm bound
entry.summary:
Author: thehyacinthgirl

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,020Chapters: 1/12Kudos: 6

Summary: When Vault 76 opens, Stiles Stilinski steps into a world gone to hell. Radiation-scorched forests, mutated beasts, and no Wi-Fi. Armed with sarcasm, a baseball bat, and way too much curiosity, he sets out to find the Overseer, with a purpose to find an answer for the darkness he left behind and ends up stumbling into a far older mystery buried in the Appalachian wilds.Derek Hale has survived the apocalypse the same way he’s survived everything else: teeth bared, walls high, and trust in no one. But when a loudmouthed Vault Dweller starts poking around werewolf territory—and then refuses to leave—Derek is forced to make a choice: protect his family or protect the boy who won’t stop looking at him like he’s something more than a monster but is holding back something from him.As the Scorched Plague spreads and enemies close in from all sides, Stiles and Derek will have to decide whether to risk everything for the fragile hope of survival… and the unexpected promise of something even rarer in a broken world: love.

entry.title: Copain of the black wolf.
entry.summary:
Author: EverythingRara

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 158,110Chapters: 18/40Kudos: 336

Summary: A Sterek rewrite of the show, that stays mostly canon compliant in the beginning, shown exclusively through the eyes of Stiles Stilinski, unknown soul mate of Derek Hale.Starts slow emotionally, my first attempt at a story of this degree please be gentle.Stiles grunted softly as he heaved himself onto the roof, his sneakers scuffing against the shingles. Scott—his best friend since forever—wasn’t answering his phone, and Stiles couldn’t wait. There was no way Scott was going to believe what Stiles had just overheard.Keeping low, Stiles crept along the roof toward Scott’s window, his heart racing as the cool night air pressed against his skin. He tried the window, but it wouldn’t budge—it was locked.“Of course it’s locked,” he muttered under his breath, rolling his eyes.Knocking softly on the glass, he leaned in closer, squinting to peer inside. The curtains were drawn, giving him only a hazy, distorted view of the room beyond. “Scott,” he hissed, rapping on the window again. No answer.Suddenly, the curtains shifted, and the window flung open. Scott and Stiles screamed, startling each other.
